alert.note: Alert for Boise Mountains; Camas Prairie; West Central Mountains (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Boise (Southwestern Idaho and Eastern Oregon)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 13 at 2:56AM MST until December 14 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Boise
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM MST TUESDAY... ...WINTER STORM WARNING IS CANCELLED... * WHAT...Snow. Additional snow accumulations of 2 to 6 inches below 6000 feet, with 10 to 18 inches over elevations above 6000 feet including high mountain passes. Winds gusting up to 35 mph. * WHERE...West Central Mountains, Boise Mountains and Camas Prairie zones in Idaho. * WHEN...Until 5 PM MST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Rising snow levels today will reduce snow accumulations for elevations below 6000 feet through tonight. A cold front will arrive tonight through Tuesday morning, lowering snow levels back down to valley floors. The period of heaviest snowfall will occur with the cold front.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Boise Mountains; Camas Prairie; West Central Mountains
